00011 #define NUMCLASS_H 1

00019 # if (!defined __PI)
00020 #   include <cmath>
00021     const double pi = 4.*atan (1.);
00022 #   define __PI 3_14

00024 
00025 template <unsigned n> class Vec {
00026   public:
00027 
00028     //----------  management  ----------
00029 
00030     //  constructor: given a pointer to double, interprets it as n-dimensional vector 
00031     //  defaults are n = Vec::DefaultDim, A = 0; they are set in the implementation,
00032     //  because they must be defined after Vec::DefaultDim
00033     Vec (); 
00034     Vec (double x0, ... ); //  Vec<n>:: constructor with variable arglist
00035   //    ~Vec (void);                                   //  destructor
00036 
00037     //----------  access      ----------
00038 
00039     //  operator [] returns a reference to component i (no boundary checking!)
00040     double &operator[] (unsigned i);
00041 
00042     //  operator [] const returns component i (read-only access, no check)
00043     double operator[] (unsigned i) const;
00044 
00045     unsigned dimension (void) const;
00046 
00047     //----------  arithmetics ----------
00048 
00049     Vec &operator+= (const Vec &Y);
00050     Vec &operator-= (const Vec &Y);
00051     Vec &operator*= (const double &s);
00052 
00053     Vec operator- (void) const;
00054     Vec operator+ (const Vec &Y);
00055     Vec operator- (const Vec &Y);
00056     Vec operator* (const double &s);
00057     double operator* (const Vec &X);
00058     Vec operator/ (const double &s);
00059 
00060     bool operator== (const Vec &Y);
00061     bool operator!= (const Vec &Y);
00062 
00063     double sqnorm (void);
00064     double norm (void);
00065     Vec normalize (void);
00066 
00067     double *data () { return x; }
00068 
00069   private:
00070     double x[n]; };
00071  
00072 template <unsigned n> ostream &operator << (ostream &, const Vec<n> &);
00073 template <unsigned n> istream &operator >> (istream &, Vec<n> &);
00074 
00075 template <unsigned n> Vec<n> cross (const Vec<n> &, const Vec<n> &);
00076 
00077

00079 
00080 //------------  Vec member functions
00081 
00082     //  ------------  management  ------------
00083 
00084 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n>::Vec<n> () { //  implicitly initialized to zero vector
00085   for (int i = 0; i < n; x[i++] = 0.);
00086 }
00087   
00088 // template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n>::~Vec<n> (void) { }
00089   
00090     //----------  access      ----------
00091 
00092 template <unsigned n> inline double &Vec<n>::operator[] (unsigned i) { 
00093   return x[i]; }                                                  //  no boundary checking!
00094 
00095 template <unsigned n> inline double Vec<n>::operator[] (unsigned i) const { 
00096   return x[i]; }                                                  //  -''- !
00097 
00098 template <unsigned n> inline unsigned Vec<n>::dimension (void) const { return n; }
00099 
00100     //----------  arithmetics ----------
00101 
00102 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> &Vec<n>::operator+= (const Vec<n> &Y) {
00103   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) x[i] += Y.x[i] ; 
00104   return *this; }
00105 
00106 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> &Vec<n>::operator-= (const Vec<n> &Y) {
00107   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) x[i] -= Y.x[i] ; 
00108   return *this; }
00109 
00110 //  scalar multiplication
00111 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> &Vec<n>::operator*= (const double &s) {
00112   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) x[i] *= s ;
00113   return *this; }
00114 
00115 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> Vec<n>::operator- (void) const {
00116   static Vec<n> Z;
00117   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) Z.x[i] = -x[i] ; 
00118   return Z; }
00119 
00120 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> Vec<n>::operator+ (const Vec<n> &Y) {
00121   static Vec<n> Z;
00122   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) Z.x[i] = x[i]+Y.x[i];
00123   return Z; }
00124 
00125 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> Vec<n>::operator- (const Vec<n> &Y) {
00126   static Vec<n> Z;
00127   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) Z.x[i] = x[i]-Y.x[i];
00128   return Z;
00129 }
00130 
00131 //  scalar multiplication
00132 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> Vec<n>::operator* (const double &s) {
00133   static Vec<n> Z;
00134   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) Z.x[i] = x[i]*s;
00135   return Z;
00136 }
00137 
00138 //  dot product
00139 template <unsigned n> inline double Vec<n>::operator* (const Vec<n> &Y) {
00140   double dot = 0.;
00141   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++)
00142     if (x[i]) dot += x[i]*Y.x[i];
00143   return dot; }
00144 
00145 //  scalar multiplication
00146 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> Vec<n>::operator/ (const double &s) {
00147   return operator* (1./s); }
00148 
00149 template <unsigned n> inline bool Vec<n>::operator== (const Vec<n> &Y) {
00150   for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) 
00151     if (x[i] != Y.x[i]) return false;
00152   return true; }
00153 
00154 template <unsigned n> inline bool Vec<n>::operator!= (const Vec<n> &Y) {
00155   return !operator== (Y); }
00156 
00157 template <unsigned n> inline double Vec<n>::sqnorm (void) {
00158   return operator* (*this); }
00159 
00160 template <unsigned n> inline double Vec<n>::norm (void) {
00161     return sqrt (sqnorm ()); }
00162 
00163 template <unsigned n> inline Vec<n> Vec<n>::normalize (void) {
00164   double nrm = sqnorm ();
00165   if (nrm > 0.) return operator* (1./sqrt (nrm));
00166   else return *this; }
00167 
00168     //----------  management  ----------
00169 
00170 //  Vec<n>:: constructor with variable arglist
00171 template <unsigned n> Vec<n>::Vec<n> (double x0, ... ) {
00172   x[0] = x0;
00173   unsigned i = 0;
00174   va_list argp;
00175   va_start (argp, x0);
00176   for (i = 1; i < n; i++) { 
00177     x[i] = va_arg (argp, double); }
00178   va_end (argp); }
00179 
00180 //------------  important non-member functions for class Vec<n>
00181 
00182 template <unsigned n> ostream &operator << (ostream &o, const Vec<n> &v) {  //  Vec<n>: output operator
00183   o << "<";                     //  might want to use other brackets one day
00184   for (unsigned i = 0; i < v.dimension ()-1; i++)
00185     o << v[i] << ",";
00186   o << v[v.dimension ()-1] << ">"; 
00187   return o; }
00188 
00189 template <unsigned n> istream &operator >> (istream &i, Vec<n> &v) {
00190   for (unsigned j = 0; j < v.dimension (); j++)
00191     i >> v[j];                      //  how about brackets?
00192 
00193   return i; }
00194 
00195 template <unsigned n> Vec<n> cross (const Vec<n> &a, const Vec<n> &b) { //  cross product of two 3D Vec<n>s
00196   if (n < 3) {
00197     cerr << "cross product for dimension < 3 is not defined." << endl;
00198     abort(); }
00199   if (n > 3) {
00200     cerr << "cross product for dimension > 3 not yet implemented, sorry." << endl;
00201     abort(); }
00202 
00203   Vec<n> c;
00204   
00205   c[0] = a[1]*b[2]-b[1]*a[2];
00206   c[1] = a[2]*b[0]-b[2]*a[0];
00207   c[0] = a[0]*b[1]-b[0]*a[1];
00208   
00209   return c; }
